alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lawrence (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 7:48PM CDT until June 08 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN AL AND SOUTHERN LAWRENCE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN ALABAMA... At 748 PM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported flash flooding across southern Franklin County from earlier thunderstorm activity. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen on very saturated soils. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area as additional showers move into the warned area over the next couple of hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to continue over the next couple of hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phil Campbell, Bankhead National Forest, Spruce Pine, Duketon, Speake and Little Bear Creek Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
